text: Cornell's estimated cost of attendance is an estimate of the total costs to attend before financial aid is applied.
The estimated cost of attendance is based on your undergraduate college, academic program, New York state residency, and housing plans.
The estimated cost of attendance includes amounts a typical full-time undergraduate student may expect for a traditional academic year (Fall and Spring).
The estimated cost is used to determine your eligibility for need-based grant and scholarship aid.
The estimated cost of attendance only includes mandatory fees charged to all students.
Fees not charged to all students, such as optional course fees, gym memberships, and premium housing options, are excluded.
The cost of the Cornell Student Health Insurance Plan (SHP) is not included in the estimated cost of attendance for financial aid.
Need-based grant or scholarship aid is not available for optional fees and the SHP cost.
The College of Architecture, Art, and Planning is an Endowed College and is charged the full tuition rate.
The College of Arts and Sciences is an Endowed College and is charged the full tuition rate.
The College of Engineering is an Endowed College and is charged the full tuition rate.
The SC Johnson College of Business is an Endowed College and is charged the full tuition rate.
The Peter and Stephanie Nolan School of Hotel Administration is an Endowed College and is charged the full tuition rate.
The Cornell Jeb E. Brooks School of Public Policy (Graduate and non-BS programs) is an Endowed College and is charged the full tuition rate.
The College of Agriculture and Life Sciences is a Contract College and offers a reduced tuition rate for New York State residents.
The Charles H. Dyson School of Applied Economics and Management (shared/CALS) is a Contract College and offers a reduced tuition rate for New York State residents.
The College of Human Ecology is a Contract College and offers a reduced tuition rate for New York State residents.
The School of Industrial and Labor Relations is a Contract College and offers a reduced tuition rate for New York State residents.
The Cornell Jeb E. Brooks School of Public Policy (Bachelor of Science candidates only) is a Contract College and offers a reduced tuition rate for New York State residents.
The annual tuition for an Endowed College (or non-NY resident) is $71,266.
The annual mandatory fees for an Endowed College (or non-NY resident) is $1,004.
The annual estimated housing for an Endowed College (or non-NY resident) is $13,246.
The annual estimated food for an Endowed College (or non-NY resident) is $7,328.
The annual books/course materials for an Endowed College (or non-NY resident) is $1,216.
The annual personal expenses for an Endowed College (or non-NY resident) is $2,208.
The annual total estimated cost for an Endowed College (or non-NY resident) is $96,268.
The annual tuition for a NY State resident in a Contract College is $48,010.
The annual mandatory fees for a NY State resident in a Contract College is $1,004.
The annual estimated housing for a NY State resident in a Contract College is $13,246.
The annual estimated food for a NY State resident in a Contract College is $7,328.
The annual books/course materials for a NY State resident in a Contract College is $1,216.
The annual personal expenses for a NY State resident in a Contract College is $2,208.
The annual total estimated cost for a NY State resident in a Contract College is $73,012.
